content.question: One end of a spring of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and spring constant <math alttext="k equals 100 newtons per meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace></mstyle><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, is attached to the ceiling as shown. The other end of the spring is attached to a small box of mass <math alttext="m sub b equals 0.6 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mi>b</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math>, and the block is released from rest. The potential energy <math alttext="U sub S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></mstyle></math> of the box-spring system as a function of the stretch of the spring, <math alttext="delta y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>y</mi></mstyle></math>, can be described as <math alttext="U sub S equals one half k, open parenthesis, delta y, close parenthesis, cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>3</mn></msup></mstyle></math>. The box is allowed to oscillate until the box-spring system comes to rest. The stretch of the spring, <math alttext="delta y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>y</mi></mstyle></math>, when the box-spring system has come completely to rest is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
